value: directions=Just 2 blocks west of city hall and municipal market

content=This little restaurant and gallery owned by El Gringo Roberto, an expat from California, offers great Tex/Mex food and typical Salvadorean foods. They are open every day for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The restaurant also has a small art gallery as well as a new hostel. Try their fish or veggie tacos, super burritos or quesadillas. If you want a real treat try the gourmet pupusas, garlic and basil, mushroom and squash just to mention a few. Robert Broz and his wife Tita are happy to provide travel information to those that ask.
directions=Just 2 blocks west of the market

content=Suchitoto's newest hostel offers two private rooms and one large dorm room with four double beds. The private rooms have great beds, a shared living room with cable TV, drinking water and a book exchange. The hostel also provides a complete braekfast for those staying in the private rooms. The owner Robert Broz also offers tours and travelers information, he is a real expert on Suchitoto and El Salvador, better than any guide book.
content=Historical hotel with suites with air conditioning, gourmet restaurant & bar, tropical gardens & pool.
content=Colonial - like hotel made of adobe and wood.
